author: m.kalinin
content:
I think a proposer should always include attestations carried by the reorged block because otherwise it is risking to create a block that will immediately be orphaned, tho the risk is low because this is an edge case. This behaviour should also be enough in order to create FFG competitive block, of course, enforcing a block that bumps justification to be a part of the chain has better guarantees.

Btw, we're at attestation block capacity in the best case when doing a reorg. If a reorged block carried old attestations they may not be included in some circumstances.

author: m.kalinin
content: I think the `finalization_ok` check with 2 epochs finality constraint is a pretty good circuit breaker. If proposed machinery affects FFG in a way that there is no justification of the previous epoch's checkpoint (this is enforced by 2 epochs part) then the machinery idles at least for the next 2 epochs
